definition:
Let $N$ be a natural number. Consider the equation $$x^2+y^2=N$$ Let
$L(N)$ denote the number of naturals $z \leq N$ such that the equation
$x^2+y^2=z$ has at least one integer solution $(x,y)$. The
Laudau-Ramanujan constant is defined as the limit
$$\lim_{N\rightarrow \infty} \frac{L(N)\sqrt{\log(N)}}{N}\approx 0.76422365358922066299069873125$$
